page.title: 08Canals
page.content: Long ago canals were used for delivering iron,steel and coal.The boats were horse drawn but when they came to a small bridge the horses would go round it.The men would have to use their feet to push on the bridge to make the boat go along.When they came out on the other side they put the horse to work again.Nowadays most canals are used for fishing and pleasure boating.A lot of people take a holiday on the canals. The canal running through Hillmorton is the Oxford canal as it runs through to Oxford.The canal was opened in 1790 There used to be three single locks but as traffic increased three new locks were made in parallel and still stand today.In 1842 no fewer than 20 859 boats passed through this part of the canal.The locks are built to take boats up to 72' long and 7' wide.
